page.title: 19CONSERVATION
page.content: Some of the cottages in Witheridge are over three hundred years old and quite a few were burnt down early this century. Just off the square, where a market used to be held,is one of the largest areas of this type of cottage. They have thatched roofs, cob walls and there are lots of narrow alleyways between the cottages and in some places the original cobblestones are to be seen. Because of the cost of re_thatching a number of people have wanted to replace the thatch with slates but have not been allowed to do so because it is now a listed area. There are a number of Footpaths in the area which tend to link up with the outlying farms,but there are no bridle paths and this causes problems between riders and walkers,
